intro: Eschweileria carpophagarum, commonly known as the false hellebore, is a member of the family Melanthiaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features a stout, rhizomatous stem with clusters of dark green, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, greenish-white, and clustered in umbels, often hidden among the foliage. The plant is known for its toxic properties, containing compounds that can be harmful to both livestock and humans.
